page.title: 01The Mound, Sutherland
page.content: The trunk road to wick, the A9, crosses the mound and curves towards Golspie. The mound is an artificial embankment bearing te road (and formerly the railway branch line to Dornoch, now closed). At the NE end are tidal sluices where salmon lie in Loch Fleet waiting for the flood tide to open the gates and let them move up river Fleet. This is a great tourist attraction and a car park has been made on the Mound. To the NW is Strath Fleet and the wooded marsh called 'The Alders' which was tidal estuary until the mound blocked it off. SE, Loch Fleet mostly dries out at low tide. Both sides are a nature conservancy reserve. N of the mound, the Lairg road (A839) joins the A9, both double-track, and a single track road to Bonar bridge runs up W from the S Side of the mound.
